page.title: 03Religion
page.content: When the newly built Parish Church in Keig was opened for worship on 11 October, 1835 the close and long liaison between Minister, Schoolmaster and Laird gave continuity and accepted leadership with the welfare of the poor being the natural concern of leaders and parishioners alike. Times have changed. Since the early 1900s there have been 10 ministries in Keig. A linkage in 1977 was formed between Alford, Tullynessle/Forbes and Keig under the Rev. J.S.A. Smith, succeeded by the Rev. Dr. Joyce Collie in 1980, each church retaining its individual Courts, Woman's Guilds and Sunday Schools. The Minister's residence is at East Manse, Alford, the accrued revenue from the sale of Keig Manse funding the upkeep of the fabric of Keig Church, Church Hall and Alford Manse.
